What is the difference between an ID selector and a class selector in CSS?
answer_1: An ID selector can only be used once per page, while a class selector can be used multiple times.
answer_2: An ID selector is more specific than a class selector.

question: Which CSS property is used to set the background color of an element?
What is the purpose of the CSS box model?
answer_1: To define the layout and spacing of elements on a web page.
answer_2: To create boxes around elements for visual styling.
answer_3: To manage the content, padding, border, and margin of elements.

question: How do you create a hyperlink in HTML?
What is the difference between inline and external CSS?
answer_1: Inline CSS is applied directly to HTML elements, while external CSS is stored in a separate file.
answer_2: Inline CSS has higher priority than external CSS.

question: What is the purpose of the src attribute in an img tag?
answer_1: To specify the height of the image.
answer_2: To specify the width of the image.
answer_3: To specify the alternative text for the image.
answer_4: To specify the source (URL) of the image.
